positive.review: This game is an odd one for the way it is. The game itself isn't a fundamentally bad idea, just sloppily thrown together for a cash grab by the devs. Looking at some of the other comments the real reviews of this game is probably a "mixed" category, but its clear there are a LOT of bot reviews. Anyways, this game was fun for a solid little while. I liked the interactions between races and the space exploration. It does get repetitive fast though. So if I'm evening out the differences, this game is getting a positive review, but only barely due to it being partially unique idea. They really should continue updating though, it's too bad they don't.

A wonderful game left to rot without promised content by it's... uhh... very loving developers

I can only recommend buying it if you plan on MODDING. Please at least get Frackin Universe! It expands upon the game and fixes SO much. I seriously cannot stand playing through the base game anymore without FU installed, it makes everything make sense.

When I say that I like starbound that would be an understatement, as you can see by my hour count, its rather unfortunate the game probably will never get another update but as the state the game is in, either mod it or just deal with it, probably 250-300 of my hours are vanilla, and the rest are modded, mods can dramatically change the gameplay Eg. Frackin Universe. or they can make it simpler like mods that skip the story, you are allowed to do what you want its a sandbox game, add spicy mods if you want or don't, make it harder or easier, that's your choice, if you are struggling to find content in this game it is my humble and honest opinion you didn't look hard enough 


Additionally i have about as much time in this game as sea of thieves and id consider them entertainment equals, with starbound having less content :) thank you for reading

I have been playing this game since its early release, and saw this game develop into a very fun, highly replayable game. If you enjoy space exploration, linear combat, tons of loot, the ability to build settlements on planets or in space, all with wonderfully retro 2D graphics, and one of the best soundtracks in gaming history, then look no further. 11/10 and highly recommended!

Starbound is a weird one for me it's everything I'd want from terraria even tho I preffer terraria over it. The modding scene is fun and recently was able to play MP which is a total blast. Like most games in MC or Terraria's sense with friends just makes it a whole other experience far surpassing solo.

While vanilla can be boring, the overhaul vibe, modding capabilities, and the freedom is very nice. While yes the game is abandoned, just means updates wont break mods! Play modded Starbound if your going to get this game, its a much better and actual fun experience. ^^

I love this game. This game is not objectively good. It is, honestly, probably mediocre at best. Terraria is probably better. But I don't like Terraria. And I love Starbound. 

The reason is mostly atmosphere. Starbound has a rich, captivating atmosphere that shows itself in the lovable artstyle, the characters, the story, and even the music. It's very charming.
And goddamnit, I got pulled in by that charm. 



If you want a 2D sandbox game with engaging gameplay, an endless variety of ways to play, and awesome boss fights; this isn't your game. You already know what is.

But, if you're looking for an adventure across the stars, with your faithful crew and rusty old starship, encountering odd creatures and ancient ruins, give Starbound a shot.

I highly consider trying mods out, by the way. The biggest issue with vanilla Starbound is its lack of variety/options, and mods like Frackin' Universe remedy that issue in really fun ways.
Starbound is great game so far. I have not completed it yet, but the gameplay style and just the general space exploration aspect of the game is really nice.
So far it's a great game that allows for exploration, questing and building. Only a small part of this game is like Terraria
super nicegame play, i have only played a bit but the story and survival s super nice-pretty much terria but ill let it slide. FAHH

Very good game, a lot like terraria but has a lot more to explore than terraria, less bosses but has a mech mechanic to the game which I love, the only thing Iâ€™m not a huge fan of is the melee attacks and how long the cooldown rate is for early weapons. But besides that and the minor lack of bosses this is a 10/10 game, especially with friends.

Starbound is pretty good. I have never played this game without the Avali triage mod, but also haven't used any of the items from it beyond cosmetics. The "story" is honestly not outstanding, and is very tedious to complete. I didn't find any of the boss fights all that engaging sadly. BUT...

I used to have this game on my old computer that could no longer connect to the internet. I probably had around 100 offline hours on this game and I must say, despite the lackluster story, it is a lot of fun. The building and item collecting is fun and engaging. I think that with more mods I could have made this game a lot more fun, and I strongly encourage players to get the Frackenuniverse mod. But, this game should be based upon its own merit, not upon the merit of a modded version. The music in the game is very very good and the main menu theme has been my top song on spotify for three years in a row. 

It's an alright game. Worth the money for sure, but your are not getting anything outstanding.
Its like Terraria, but with a lot of cool other features and stuff because its space themed.

Terraria but in space undersells this game. It may have started by trying to do what terraria did, but it's a lot more than just a terraria clone now.
I had some weird issues with restarting the story, though. After my first playthrough, any subsequent runs already had the final boss unlocked? Whether that's intentional or not, it's kind of annoying.
Fun little exploration game, but base building is quite the undertaking. Expect to lose many hours.

All but abandoned by the devs as last I heard of development, but the modding community is as strong as ever and keeping this alive. Still a bit twitchy and buggy, so save often and try to be caareful about mod choices if your machine may have trouble keeping up. Otherwise, still a fun experience to mess around in.
Theoretically, there is nothing stopping me from destroying an entire planet if I wanted to. 10/10, this game is astronomically good.

At first, the game started off as an annoying grind, kept dying to almost anything and having to go back and forth... but once you get your ship repaired, this game is nothing short of mind blowing and addictive as heck. It's like a No Man's Sky in 2D with similar gameplay to Terraria in terms of mining, building, and even combat. Definitely recommend it to anyone interested in exploration

Starbound is a great space exploration game full of different planets and diverse creatures. It's a game I always come back to because there is plenty to do and each playthrough is unique. Each race has its own history and traits. Upgrading and expanding your ship is also pretty fun because you can decorate it and each race gets a different layout for it. There are plenty of boss battles, creatures to collect, and NPCs to befriend or recruit. My only regret is they stopped updating this game! It's a cute little gem.

Theres a lot to love about Starbound. Good music, good art style, a nice little story for a sandbox game. Despite all the time I've spent in it I'm certain there's still more to be found. More biomes, more outfits, more weapons. The nice thing is that even if I did find all of it there's still mods to explore. You can sink so much time into this game for what it costs. Get out there and start exploring the stars.
This game is only good when you mod it so much that its hardly the same as the base game.
this game is super cute and cozy, practically stardew valley in space but not

This is one of those games you play vanilla once to experience the mediocre story, then absolutely obliterate with mods until the game twice its size and nearly unrecognizable. Fortunately, for most modding purposes (sex mod not included) the game behaves really well, and has great workshop support. For $15, it's a really fun time and you can find yourself sinking hundreds of hours into it like myself if you really do some digging around in the workshop.

A game that can easily become a adventurers wet dream.   When combined with a handful of mods (fracking) it turns into a crazier sandbox with a enormous amount of questing, tinkering, and jumping planets while making homes across solar systems.

Terraria in 3d?... wait no... It's terraria in space

Love them both equally so that should speak to the quality of this sucka
Love this game so much, Been playing it off and on since Beta and though it's no longer updated the modding community has been wonderful keeping it alive.

so unlike the people whining its too boring and never touched a game like this before,
i will say this game is still amazing, bonus points with the mods,
opened this up after years and god did i love playing this, even beaten it on hardcore a few times,
not sure why so many hate the game xD
Terraria but in space honestly truly amazing, bonus points cuz it even has interesting bosses and even interesting bios
with mods its even more crazy fun, if you get stuck theres guides out the but for this game,
theres even a mod that has its fully customize story that they came out with very tear jerking,
mind you you will die alot, it takes time to get anywhere, but that means more gameplay for your buck,
not sure why people want a stupid short game anymore not me i prefer them long and feel i earned everything then it being dull the whole time
besides that try it your self theres a reason this game is very positive and its been that way for years xD honestly ignore the point that said 'don't recommend' honestly whiny cod players i tell you

It's actually a 50/50 game, there needs to be more guides on how to do things, the developers just assume you know everything already??? Also please give some hint about each mission, im stuck in the first planet for hours not having a clue. Would appreciate a GPS system or map, and a teleport-to-home button.

Incredible game. Been playing since 2017, and it's a lot of fun. The story, the mobs, the weapons, everything is well made. It's the space variant of terraria. The progression isn't too difficult. Bosses are easy to understand. Loot doesn't feel too grindy to get a good weapon. Multiplayer is always fun. Great game, 10/10 would recommend to any space sandbox lover.
i love how the modding bit is still working on the dame for us player thank you stream workshop and others
Very good, get Frackin Universe Mod from workshop and Better Containers mod, and thats all you need
Next best thing to Terraria.  Still wish it was in development or a sequel.

Exciting at first and feels expansive, but be aware that there's a point (after dozens of hours) where you realize you've more or less seen everything, and that the main storyline can only continue if you manage to stumble upon what you need in a plethora of RNG world generation.

lo amo es muy variado si te gusta el tema de viajar por el universo muy rejugable y con muchas cosas por hacer unos mods de comunidad que hacen aun mas largo el juego (la historia esta bien culebra pero ni pedo algo malo tenia que tener)
it is really fun and cool there is so much to do

Everything in the game grabs you, with a cool story that pulls you along and simple exploration that just works. Hopping between planets, digging around, finding weird stuff feels so satisfying and endless.

When people ask me if I play Terraria, I tell them I'm more of a Starbound girlie. ;)
It's a really good game, one of my favorites even, but I wish it got the same TLC terraria gets, i think if it  had kept getting updates, it could've rivalled  Terraria to this day.

I know so many people love to hate on this game, but I still love this game. Imagine a game with the fun visuals of terraria, the vast exploration of No man's sky, and the nostalgic music of minecraft all rolled into one. While the game has a few kinks (which mods can fix) the game's heart is there waiting to be explored

"I set out to explore the stars. Ended up running an interplanetary chicken farm."

Landed on a radioactive planet.
Immediately got attacked by a penguin with a laser gun.
Found a medieval village underwater.
Married a frog.
Now I fight cosmic horrors using a frying pan named "Justice."

I don't know what genre this game is anymore.
RPG? Platformer? Stardew Valley in space? Terraria's weirder cousin?

Also, my ship is full of cats and I can't remember why.

10/10.
Got lost for 3 hours trying to build a staircase.
Would terraform the universe again.

A wonderful game left to rot without promised content by it's... uhh... very loving developers

I can only recommend buying it if you plan on MODDING. Please at least get Frackin Universe! It expands upon the game and fixes SO much. I seriously cannot stand playing through the base game anymore without FU installed, it makes everything make sense.

This game is an odd one for the way it is. The game itself isn't a fundamentally bad idea, just sloppily thrown together for a cash grab by the devs. Looking at some of the other comments the real reviews of this game is probably a "mixed" category, but its clear there are a LOT of bot reviews. Anyways, this game was fun for a solid little while. I liked the interactions between races and the space exploration. It does get repetitive fast though. So if I'm evening out the differences, this game is getting a positive review, but only barely due to it being partially unique idea. They really should continue updating though, it's too bad they don't.

Starbound is basically what happens when someone looked at Terraria and thought, â€œYeah, thatâ€™s cool, but what if there were more galaxies and, like, penguins with firearms?â€ And, for some reason, the devs just went, â€œHeck yeah, letâ€™s roll with it.â€

So you kick things off stranded in your busted spaceship a.k.a. game dev shorthand for get ready to punch trees and hoard shrubbery for the next 40 hours while the actual storyline gathers dust in the corner. Sure, thereâ€™s technically a universe that needs saving, but let's be real most of your time is spent tunneling straight into the dirt on some random planet, immediately forgetting which rock you crawled out from.

Now, about those planets. "Procedurally generated" sounds fancy, but it really means you'll hop between a million IKEA wannabe biomes with the same three pieces of alien furniture, just in different shades. â€œWow, a planet full of cacti.â€ Jump a bit. â€œWhoa, snowâ€¦ and, uh, cacti again. Neat.â€ Somehow itâ€™s the same, but you donâ€™t get bored. Go figure.

Combat? Oh man. Itâ€™s a hot mess, but itâ€™s a good time. One minute youâ€™re swinging a sword the size of a Buick, next youâ€™re blasting a trumpet bazooka, then bam some demonic bird drops in and absolutely wrecks you. Birds in this game are like Navy SEALs with wings and unresolved trauma.

Now, if youâ€™re into building, this is where Starbound really flexes. You can go full HGTV with space castles and farms, or if youâ€™re lazy like me just slap down a sad little dirt box and abandon it the second you see shinier terrain. But hey, if youâ€™ve got patience, maybe youâ€™ll build something that doesnâ€™t look like a rejected LEGO set.

Letâ€™s talk about the penguin mafia. Yeah, you heard me. Full on space penguins in trench coats, handing out black market quests like itâ€™s no big deal. At that point, logic just packs its bags and leaves. Youâ€™re in fever dream territory now think Minecraft, Terraria, and some weird underground art film all mashed together.

Bottom line Starbound is a wild, lovable mess of a space sandbox. You can go be the galaxyâ€™s hero or just lose three hours trying to breed chickens with antennae. Honestly, both are solid life choices.

I've played this game for years, especially when I began modding it, but even before then when I played it vanilla, I knew this game would become one of my top 3 most favorite games, the sprite style art is endearing and cute, the controls are smooth and easy to pick up on, combat can be a nice balanced challenge especially against a group of enemies or bosses, mods definitely give more to explore with new worlds and more customization for characters it gives hours of fun both for solo games or playing with friends.

When I say that I like starbound that would be an understatement, as you can see by my hour count, its rather unfortunate the game probably will never get another update but as the state the game is in, either mod it or just deal with it, probably 250-300 of my hours are vanilla, and the rest are modded, mods can dramatically change the gameplay Eg. Frackin Universe. or they can make it simpler like mods that skip the story, you are allowed to do what you want its a sandbox game, add spicy mods if you want or don't, make it harder or easier, that's your choice, if you are struggling to find content in this game it is my humble and honest opinion you didn't look hard enough 


Additionally i have about as much time in this game as sea of thieves and id consider them entertainment equals, with starbound having less content :) thank you for reading

I have been playing this game since its early release, and saw this game develop into a very fun, highly replayable game. If you enjoy space exploration, linear combat, tons of loot, the ability to build settlements on planets or in space, all with wonderfully retro 2D graphics, and one of the best soundtracks in gaming history, then look no further. 11/10 and highly recommended!

[h1] How I started playing Starbound [/h1]

Started out playing Starbound by moving the game files from my brothers computer who had bought the game onto my own computer and on that account I amounted to over 1,000 hours of playtime, most of which is modded, I enjoy this game so much I bought it on this account that is my own. The hours played shown here aren't all the time I have played this game for. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone wanting a fun game to fuck around in. My experience has also given me the knowledge of various sites for good mods to play with.

[h1] Steam Workshop: [/h1] Started out installing mods from here, not great, not terrible. It has up to date mods and lets you use premade modpacks.

[h1] Nexus Mods: [/h1] Classic site, has some mods you won't find on Steam Workshop.

[h1] LoversLab: [/h1] In case you want to make your Starbound experience "Spicy" I won't judge, I did it too, very fun. If you don't know where to start here, choose sexbound and a few of it's addons.

despite the "bootleg terraria" allegations, this game is actually great, and (TW!! OPINION) great, yeah it needs a bit of fine tuning, but there are mods to help with that, story is good, mechanics are fun, especially building (big builder here), and the universe actually being infinite is a great touch too seeing as how its all proceduraly generated (think minecraft generation lowkey), you want more races, modding community has solutions, which is great seeing as how the game wont have any updates (if they ever revisit this game i will jump with joy), over all 8/10 experience thus far.

Starbound is a weird one for me it's everything I'd want from terraria even tho I preffer terraria over it. The modding scene is fun and recently was able to play MP which is a total blast. Like most games in MC or Terraria's sense with friends just makes it a whole other experience far surpassing solo.

I love this game. This game is not objectively good. It is, honestly, probably mediocre at best. Terraria is probably better. But I don't like Terraria. And I love Starbound. 

The reason is mostly atmosphere. Starbound has a rich, captivating atmosphere that shows itself in the lovable artstyle, the characters, the story, and even the music. It's very charming.
And goddamnit, I got pulled in by that charm. 



If you want a 2D sandbox game with engaging gameplay, an endless variety of ways to play, and awesome boss fights; this isn't your game. You already know what is.

But, if you're looking for an adventure across the stars, with your faithful crew and rusty old starship, encountering odd creatures and ancient ruins, give Starbound a shot.

I highly consider trying mods out, by the way. The biggest issue with vanilla Starbound is its lack of variety/options, and mods like Frackin' Universe remedy that issue in really fun ways.

Great game I havn't touched in over 10 years going to try and motivate myself to catch up on my broken mods possibly make some fix's my old larger mod was (Wild Things) catch pets on your journey with a touch of survival elements and hunting capabilities for food, weapons, etc. Check Starbound out it always had a great community.

Base game is fun and immersive but only for a very short time, the story and missions are short and the universe has little variety (after a few dozen hours you will have seen everything a few times). The OST is beautiful and memorable. You can enjoy this game as a relaxing base builder if you want to play long term, if you want exploration and more content just download one of the top mods and you will add hours of fun.
This is one of those "its ok on its own but its fucking baller with mods" types of experiences.

Starbound is a sandbox adventure that makes it easy to lose yourself in the stars for days on end.
ðŸŽ¶ Soundtrack Excellence
- The music is one of the best in gaming, perfectly capturing the wonder of space exploration.
- From soothing melodies to epic crescendos, the soundtrack sets the tone for every journey.
- Itâ€™s the kind of score that makes wandering through alien worlds feel timeless and immersive.
ðŸš€ Exploration & Discovery
- The game offers infinite planets to explore, each with unique biomes, creatures, and mysteries.
- Itâ€™s easy to get lost in the rhythm of discoveryâ€”building, adventuring, and uncovering secrets across the galaxy.
- The sense of scale and freedom is unmatched, making every playthrough feel fresh.
ðŸŽ¨ Style & Atmosphere
- The pixel art is vibrant and charming, balancing retro aesthetics with modern polish.
- Combined with the soundtrack, it creates a dreamlike atmosphere that keeps you coming back.
âœ¨ Final Thoughts
Starbound is more than a sandboxâ€”itâ€™s a cosmic journey. With one of the best soundtracks in gaming and endless opportunities for exploration, itâ€™s a game that makes getting lost in space feel like time well spent.

At first it had so much potential, now I just feel like I was scammed.

I've played this game on and off for years, really tried to like it, but I gotta finally admit, it's a terrible game. Everything about it is annoying, it's marred by a history of controversies and poor treatment of their own "interns" and it very much shows. Movement is slow, quests are fetch, enemies are bullet sponges, weapons are weak, nothing feels satisfying.

One star, music is awesome.

i love starbound. i have spent so much fucking time on this game just exploring and messing around in the different worlds and dungeons. if you loved terraria for the exploration and grinding, this game is for you. 

that being said, ive ONLY played this game while heavily modded. from what ive seen, the base game looks horrible. unfinished, bland, overzealous. i highly advice installing frackin universe and any other fun mods you see for the game. it makes an abandoned game whole again. 

so, i cant, in good faith, reccommend the game, but if you mod it and buy it on sale, its definitely an amazing time waster.
I love this game but the game feels very half finshed. The game had so much potential but from the sound of it the devs were exploited by the publisher leading to the dead game it is today.

I enjoyed the game. I think there's the bones of a good game, but Chucklefish fumbled this so badly. It's a miracle that the modding community has done as much as they have. If you really want to play the game, don't buy it. Use family sharing (or other methods) to play.

I'm sure it picks up but I'd rather just play terraria over this, literally any day of the week, forever.

BUT NO!!! just enemies, enemies, enemies, oh hey look, some people, nope more enemies. great, yeah, exactly what i needed MORE ENEMIES!!! and the fact that the developers added a hardcore mode; has got to be some kinda of trolling. you die easily in this game! theirs no way in hell your character will live long. i do not recommend this game, unless, you like to digitally torture your self. i regret buying this game!

I've played this game on and off for years, really tried to like it, but I gotta finally admit, it's a terrible game. Everything about it is annoying, it's marred by a history of controversies and poor treatment of their own "interns" and it very much shows. Movement is slow, quests are fetch, enemies are bullet sponges, weapons are weak, nothing feels satisfying.

One star, music is awesome.

A very fun experience I cannot in good conscience recommend.

I'll start by saying I enjoy playing Starbound. I am fully capable of having a good time with it, it's a complete product I enjoy.

But it's moreso having fun IN SPITE of the game, not BECAUSE of the game. Heck, I'd hesitate to call it a 'game' rather than a 'framework'. Starbound is a game hard carried by its modding scene; the vanilla experience is wide as an ocean yet deep as a puddle: The story is little more than a galactic fetch quest, the gameplay is whatever, the combat is meh, and the world is spread so thin it doesn't have any fat to chew on.

The progression is very similar to Terraria, as in 'harvest resources in order to harvest better resources and fight bosses so you can harvest better resources'. However unlike Terraria, it doesn't feel as good precisely because it spreads itself too thin. You have no incentive to build anything, as while there is NPC housing, there are very little worthwhile rewards that come from it, and since you keep moving across the galaxy, you're rarely in one place for long enough for it to be worth it. This, coupled with the fact that there are thousands of the same planet type, you don't get endeared to the world in the same way you do with Terraria.

I wasn't around much for the alpha (I joined during the Spirited Giraffe version of the beta) so I don't mind the cut content too much, but it still pains me a little. Additionally, while it's not the game itself's fault, the development behind it was problematic, featuring theft and unpaid work, but this is a review of Starbound, not Chuckle Fish themselves, so I won't go too deep. Still worth noting.

There are other games like Rimworld and Kerbal Space Program that also have their replay value hard carried by their modding scene, but those games also have a fun vanilla experience and didn't have nearly as controversial of a development phase. While I am capable of having a lot of fun with Starbound, I can't say I like the vanilla experience at all. I can't recommend a game solely for its modding scene, but there's a lot of hours to be had if you have the game and give them a go. Definitely one of those games you only every play vanilla for one playthrough and never again.

Now that I think about it, this game is the polar opposite of No Man's Sky. Both are absolutely massive space sims set across the entire cosmos that launched with broken promises, yet one of them bothered to continue its development and as such blossomed into an actually complete experience with lots of vanilla hours, while the other stopped receiving updates after interest died from how shallow the game was.

But hey, if you still get this game anyway, the modding scene really is that good. Frackin' Universe gives you a much more fleshed out experience, Shellguard is a great expansion to the vanilla experience, and Galaxy in Conflict is an amazing milsim. It does pain me that there's only one universe, so you have to keep swapping the files around whenever you want to play a different universe generation mod like Arcana or GiC, and the fact that there's no mod profiles you can easily swap through is kinda sad, but what're you gonna do, because the devs aren't going to do anything, for sure.

Abandoned, repetitive game with dumb quests. At first it had a promising story which as it progresses becomes sloppy and boring repetitive chore...
At first it had so much potential, now I just feel like I was scammed.
a good game that never reached even the floor of its potential... dont support these devs.

I can't in good conscience positively review a game that was such a disaster development wise, especially with how badly CF treated the various people brought in to develop it. The core game is literally only good when you mod it, and while that wouldn't normally be a deal breaker for me, the garbage behavior of the leads behind this game are.
I love this game but the game feels very half finshed. The game had so much potential but from the sound of it the devs were exploited by the publisher leading to the dead game it is today.

I love this game, I really do, but for gods sake do not play it. The game starts out really fun, but that's it. After a certain point it feels like hallow, empty calories. You can appreciate the collectible lore books, the time it took to design certain race's cites. But once you get to actually doing the story, it feels like nothing. Sure, there is a threat, but you don't feel compelled to take care of it, because the grindy gameplay that tricks you into feeling like your not grinding as well as no indicator that this "threat" is really doing anything. Combat is too simple for its own good as well, making all wildlife enemies a breeze if you have a half-decent spear. Becasue of all of this, you have to install mods to give you any real directive or incentive to do directives, ie: Frackin' Universe mod. But if you want to treat the game like a sandbox you really can't, due to crafting stations needing to be upgraded with mid-to-late-game materials just to let you craft futuristic blocks and furniture. With the addition to mechs that do nothing but pad out the non-story gameplay part of the game means that the devs are aware of these problems and are not directly fixing them.

I only like this game because of nostalgia at this point.
3/10

Picked this game up when it was early access and seemed to be a Terraria rival. It was fun enough back then. Running around on new planets, finding new planets, jotting down coordinates... it was a good time.  Since then, the game was fully released and updated into something unrecognizable. The simplicity in what made the game fun back then no longer exists. No longer a simple galaxy sized sandbox with treasures to find. The game tries to do too much. What seemed to have promise completely did not live up to expectations. Not being dramatic when I say this, but I regret my purchase.

A mile wide and an inch deep. Starbound is full of lots of ideas that never pan out, lots of 'stuff' that serves no real purpose, and just generally fails to live up to its potential. It tries so hard to be bigger and better than Terraria, that it didn't stop to make sure that the things it was doing, it was doing well.

Theres nothing offensively bad about Starbound, theres just nothing about it that makes it worth playing over other options. I wanted so much to like it, but incredibly disappointing overall, and a game i have no desire to ever revisit. Could probably be saved with mods, but i have limited interest in looking into that.

Nothing about this game is noteworthy. I think I tend to be the kind of person that finds beauty in the garbage but this game isn't garbage - it's just painfully mediocre, with no stand-out moments or parts.

I don't like directly comparing games but 90% of my playtime I just felt like I was playing a weird, clunky, slow and grindy version of Terraria. There's a lot of content to go through but it all blends together and after a few years of not having played it I struggled to actually remember any of it.

i love starbound. i have spent so much fucking time on this game just exploring and messing around in the different worlds and dungeons. if you loved terraria for the exploration and grinding, this game is for you. 

that being said, ive ONLY played this game while heavily modded. from what ive seen, the base game looks horrible. unfinished, bland, overzealous. i highly advice installing frackin universe and any other fun mods you see for the game. it makes an abandoned game whole again. 

so, i cant, in good faith, reccommend the game, but if you mod it and buy it on sale, its definitely an amazing time waster.
Purchased because I enjoyed Terraria. This game is unoptimized and many of the systems seem like they are incomplete.

This game has potential, In most all its systems... However the story just... Abruptly ends. You can tell the writers and developers did not get the time they needed for this game.

It's somewhat fun, but severely lacking in... depth. Don't expect a Terraria level of things to do.

chuckle fish is garbage. fracking universe mod. do not buy this game at full price. chuckle fish screws everyone over. so dish it back. otherwise.. it's a cute game with the mods, modding community stepped up when chucklefish decided to take erryones money n run., :]

chucklefish still sucks. FU creators are sus. The game can still be enjoyable. Better with friends to help dissipate the toxicity that surrounds the game devs and the FU mods lmao. [fr FU, how do you get away with stealing copyrighted music from Miyazaki? I'm surprised they haven't slammed your dumbasses with CND LOL]

First, I love the base-building and spaceship mechanics, they are simple, but a lot of fun to work with. The artstyle is clean, and the monsters are cute. I even love the critters, which range from snails to owls.
The story is fine, although over very quickly.
HOWEVER, even more than 300 hours in, I'm still not used to the controls, all the planets look the same, I HATE the food spoilage mechanic, and I actually resent this game for wasting my time, because so many of the achievements are boring, repetitive time-sinks.

Here are the worst;
-Finishing 50 minor sidequests for your colonists, who will pick 1 of about 3 quest templates. Boring and repetitive, but doable if you're grinding out the food achievement, just make a farm near the colony.
-Complete a specific, rare costume, where you MIGHT find one piece per galaxy, if you're lucky, and what piece you find is random.
-Dig and carry a planet's worth of dirt (No, this will not happen organically).
-Catch all the bugs, several of which require specific rare biomes, and one of the rare ones is effectively invisible.
-Collect all the armor types in game, which requires many, many hours of grinding and randomly spawned merchants, who MIGHT sell you an armor piece you don't already have.
-Collecting all the fossils, which are random. And have rarities. And a failable minigame. And only spawn underground. And there are 55 of the hateful things.
-And, finally, the one that broke me, collecting 50 **********ing figurines. After 368.2 hours, killing every monster I saw, and grinding bosses, I had 4. And 8 hours later, after grinding more bosses (who have a higher drop-rate), I had 6. That's when I just spawned them in with console commands, because **** that. 
What little of this game I play in future will be entirely to hang out with friends who invite me, and, even the, I will recommend we play a different game first.

I enjoyed the game. I think there's the bones of a good game, but Chucklefish fumbled this so badly. It's a miracle that the modding community has done as much as they have. If you really want to play the game, don't buy it. Use family sharing (or other methods) to play.

[h1] 5.5/10 [/h1]

Good game idea, it could've been Terraria with space travel and super sandbox design but unfortunatly due to devs it's just an okay game thats why I give it a negative review. You can get it to have fun for about 20-30 hours but there are better games at the same price in the same genre that you could spend more hours and enjoy more.

I'm sure it picks up but I'd rather just play terraria over this, literally any day of the week, forever.

Seriously. FUCK THIS GAME!!!!! it takes forever to get anything done! all i've been doing is digging, fighting, starving, dying and look for crystals. rinse and repeat, even on the most easiest mode, this game is still ruthless, all the random ass creatures keep coming at you, so many times i was hoping to find some more food, medicine, better weapons or armor, you know, anything useful! BUT NO!!! just enemies, enemies, enemies, oh hey look, some people, nope more enemies. great, yeah, exactly what i needed MORE ENEMIES!!! and the fact that the developers added a hardcore mode; has got to be some kinda of trolling. you die easily in this game! theirs no way in hell your character will live long. i do not recommend this game, unless, you like to digitally torture your self. i regret buying this game!

While I enjoyed Starbound, I don't think I'd recommend it to others. Like others, I found enjoyment in my first playthrough. Without mods, the game doesn't really mean much past that. I'm also upset by the allegations that the developers didn't pay their artists appropriately. There are much better 2D Sandbox Survival games that respect their artists and modders out there that I'd recommend more.

Good Luck!! Don't get me wrong.  I really enjoyed playing the game; when it would decide to work.

Played the game a few years back on the same PC and hardware.  I don't know if Windows updates ruined it but the game refuses to launch in a stable resolution full screen now.  I can't stand playing games using a "window" and know this wasn't an issue prior.  

Tried multiple resolutions; manually configuring the game files but it would either change the default back to 800 x 600 upon launch or generate a new config file ignoring the old.  Such a shame because it was fun to play.  Just be warned that you might be wasting $$

Apparently the internet is full of forums similar to my experience...  shame

I was a kickstarter backer when this game was in Early Access. I remember trying this for the first time back then, and I found the game desolate, repetitive, and needlessly grindy.

I decided to give it another try yesterday, because surely 10 years is enough to iron out all the flaws. I dug all the way to the core of the planet. I did the first dungeon and beat the first story boss. The game feels as desolate and empty as ever, and the echoey music just helps amplify that feeling. UI is awful, combat is awful, building is... serviceable but awkward because of how little you can place on the hotbar, forcing you to manually pick up items from the inventory items. Yes, people say "the mods are great" but that doesn't say anything good for the game itself. I wouldn't recommend buying this game even on sale, this is a game designed to waste your time, and not in a fun way.
Expected more from the story mode, also kinda boring, confusing and unbalanced.

this game is soooooo boring and underdeveloped without mods, they treated their devs like shit and this is what you get. not worth playing without tons of mods to make the game actually fun while letting you skip the awful vanilla content

This game is rather bland in comparison to other game similar to this, Terraria for example. Terraria is endlessly replay-able, and feels fresh every time, Starbound is grindy, bare, and empty. Not to mention the modding sucks, I modded my game and a few days later, I launch the game, and it would crash over and over again. I would not recommend this game, go buy Terraria instead.

Starbound. This one is tough cuz i do truly love this game

However i dont find myself wanting to come back super often. i usually need like a good year or two of a break before i even want to or think about coming back to it. All my memories of the game are fun. But after a couple days of playing i usually find myself a bit overwhelmed with... too many choices i guess? There so so so much you can do in the universe you play in. which kinda makes everything you do feel kinda lack luster. I have friends who've beat the game but they don't come back to it the way they will for other games. 

Lets put it this way. If you have some friends and yall have gone nothing to do and you want a fun game to play with them. This is your game. OR if you like to be alone... like in real life. If you're going through a rough time and you wanna dissociate and just get away. Get lost in something for awhile. This is the game for that. It can be exhilarating at times if you fully fully immerse yourself. But Would i recommend this game to someone...?

No i don't think i would. This is a Good, fun, enjoyable, creative, and unique game! Truly I mean that and i cherish the experiences i had with it. But i'd sooner buy someone a game like terraria... or simply just go for a walk and hang out outside. do something else creative before i even consider this one and that's the truth with zero malice in my heart. I got nothin but love for this game.

But hey if you got some extra buckaroons to spare and you just wanna try something out. You can get a good week or two of fun with this game before you get bored. Go for it! itll be worth the money. You could spend the same amount on a fast food meal and be less satisfied, get me?

Even though I played through the whole game, I have mixed feelings about it. 

The art direction and lore seemed to be pretty solid. It was fun exploring all the planets and different races. Music and sound design worked well, and i Loved the little outpost area: so full of life! Building in this game is a lot of fun, even though the hotbar is severely limited. There are SO many items you can decorate with, so there seems to be endless possibilities!

But i just had too many little annoyances that kept me from truly enjoying myself. 
The travelling by ship mechanic is never explained. 
The upgrading your crafting stations mechanic is never explained. 
The main story is 5x the same process/questline but with a different race
The storge system is diabolical, why is there no smart stacking feature? 
It is completely hidden how to recruit members for your ship, and even if you know, the process is tedious, repetitive and boring.  
The feature of placing/breaking walls is never explained. 
Money is too scarce in the beginning, and not important in the endgame
You're unkillable by the time you reach the endboss
Progression always follows the same schematic: planet -> 1 new ore -> upgrade gear and breating device -> new planet type
The "riddles" were not hard at all, although the jump and run parts and challenge portals were fun.
The amount of time i spend mindlessly walking on the surface of planets searching for a specific structure to "find clues" about a race is about 40-50% of my 30 hours of playtime. Absolutely NOT fun to search the entire planet for a avian village on the correct planet and star type, only to find out it only houses another race.

This game was fun enough for me to finish it, but i was annoyed, or felt like i was doing the same thing over and over  a lot of the time. There is more stuff to do like expand your ship (which requires A LOT of crew, which, as said, is annoying to hire!) or mess with pets or activate the arks you find in some solar systems, but the game was not fun enough for me to care.
basicly terraria but more bad, get terraria, its better.

I go to the left, I die. I go to the right, I die. I go into a mine, I die from fall damage. This game is so hostile to me I just, I can't figure this out.

I swear to god If I need to look at a fucking wiki just to play a game, then I look forward to refunding this.
Worst game in history of gaming! Got baited from a friend into buying this game. Wasted 5 â‚¬ :(
boring ahh game
Wasted potential

Could Be a lot better of a vanilla game but for what it is its not the worst but nor the best. For this to be the most fun Modded is the way to go but. For the moneys worth i will say get it on sale. otherwise you might be disapointed.
my friend told me that it sucks
as hideo kojima would put it: "I played starbound."
My friend say this is good  just to disagree with him im giving this a no

So I noticed that there were a lot of paid reviews here so I though I would add my two bits, this game is functionally abandoned. If you want to play it go and play anyone of the open source projects you'll have a much better time than playing this garbage.

P.S. The lead dev likes to claim he's being review bombed 24/7 and uses bots/paid shills to boost his number on online platforms.

I've played this game on and off for years, really tried to like it, but I gotta finally admit, it's a terrible game. Everything about it is annoying, it's marred by a history of controversies and poor treatment of their own "interns" and it very much shows. Movement is slow, quests are fetch, enemies are bullet sponges, weapons are weak, nothing feels satisfying.

One star, music is awesome.

A very fun experience I cannot in good conscience recommend.

I'll start by saying I enjoy playing Starbound. I am fully capable of having a good time with it, it's a complete product I enjoy.

But it's moreso having fun IN SPITE of the game, not BECAUSE of the game. Heck, I'd hesitate to call it a 'game' rather than a 'framework'. Starbound is a game hard carried by its modding scene; the vanilla experience is wide as an ocean yet deep as a puddle: The story is little more than a galactic fetch quest, the gameplay is whatever, the combat is meh, and the world is spread so thin it doesn't have any fat to chew on.

The progression is very similar to Terraria, as in 'harvest resources in order to harvest better resources and fight bosses so you can harvest better resources'. However unlike Terraria, it doesn't feel as good precisely because it spreads itself too thin. You have no incentive to build anything, as while there is NPC housing, there are very little worthwhile rewards that come from it, and since you keep moving across the galaxy, you're rarely in one place for long enough for it to be worth it. This, coupled with the fact that there are thousands of the same planet type, you don't get endeared to the world in the same way you do with Terraria.

I wasn't around much for the alpha (I joined during the Spirited Giraffe version of the beta) so I don't mind the cut content too much, but it still pains me a little. Additionally, while it's not the game itself's fault, the development behind it was problematic, featuring theft and unpaid work, but this is a review of Starbound, not Chuckle Fish themselves, so I won't go too deep. Still worth noting.

There are other games like Rimworld and Kerbal Space Program that also have their replay value hard carried by their modding scene, but those games also have a fun vanilla experience and didn't have nearly as controversial of a development phase. While I am capable of having a lot of fun with Starbound, I can't say I like the vanilla experience at all. I can't recommend a game solely for its modding scene, but there's a lot of hours to be had if you have the game and give them a go. Definitely one of those games you only every play vanilla for one playthrough and never again.

Now that I think about it, this game is the polar opposite of No Man's Sky. Both are absolutely massive space sims set across the entire cosmos that launched with broken promises, yet one of them bothered to continue its development and as such blossomed into an actually complete experience with lots of vanilla hours, while the other stopped receiving updates after interest died from how shallow the game was.

But hey, if you still get this game anyway, the modding scene really is that good. Frackin' Universe gives you a much more fleshed out experience, Shellguard is a great expansion to the vanilla experience, and Galaxy in Conflict is an amazing milsim. It does pain me that there's only one universe, so you have to keep swapping the files around whenever you want to play a different universe generation mod like Arcana or GiC, and the fact that there's no mod profiles you can easily swap through is kinda sad, but what're you gonna do, because the devs aren't going to do anything, for sure.

Abandoned, repetitive game with dumb quests. At first it had a promising story which as it progresses becomes sloppy and boring repetitive chore...
At first it had so much potential, now I just feel like I was scammed.
a good game that never reached even the floor of its potential... dont support these devs.

I can't in good conscience positively review a game that was such a disaster development wise, especially with how badly CF treated the various people brought in to develop it. The core game is literally only good when you mod it, and while that wouldn't normally be a deal breaker for me, the garbage behavior of the leads behind this game are.
I love this game but the game feels very half finshed. The game had so much potential but from the sound of it the devs were exploited by the publisher leading to the dead game it is today.

I love this game, I really do, but for gods sake do not play it. The game starts out really fun, but that's it. After a certain point it feels like hallow, empty calories. You can appreciate the collectible lore books, the time it took to design certain race's cites. But once you get to actually doing the story, it feels like nothing. Sure, there is a threat, but you don't feel compelled to take care of it, because the grindy gameplay that tricks you into feeling like your not grinding as well as no indicator that this "threat" is really doing anything. Combat is too simple for its own good as well, making all wildlife enemies a breeze if you have a half-decent spear. Becasue of all of this, you have to install mods to give you any real directive or incentive to do directives, ie: Frackin' Universe mod. But if you want to treat the game like a sandbox you really can't, due to crafting stations needing to be upgraded with mid-to-late-game materials just to let you craft futuristic blocks and furniture. With the addition to mechs that do nothing but pad out the non-story gameplay part of the game means that the devs are aware of these problems and are not directly fixing them.

I only like this game because of nostalgia at this point.
3/10

Picked this game up when it was early access and seemed to be a Terraria rival. It was fun enough back then. Running around on new planets, finding new planets, jotting down coordinates... it was a good time.  Since then, the game was fully released and updated into something unrecognizable. The simplicity in what made the game fun back then no longer exists. No longer a simple galaxy sized sandbox with treasures to find. The game tries to do too much. What seemed to have promise completely did not live up to expectations. Not being dramatic when I say this, but I regret my purchase.

A mile wide and an inch deep. Starbound is full of lots of ideas that never pan out, lots of 'stuff' that serves no real purpose, and just generally fails to live up to its potential. It tries so hard to be bigger and better than Terraria, that it didn't stop to make sure that the things it was doing, it was doing well.

Theres nothing offensively bad about Starbound, theres just nothing about it that makes it worth playing over other options. I wanted so much to like it, but incredibly disappointing overall, and a game i have no desire to ever revisit. Could probably be saved with mods, but i have limited interest in looking into that.

Nothing about this game is noteworthy. I think I tend to be the kind of person that finds beauty in the garbage but this game isn't garbage - it's just painfully mediocre, with no stand-out moments or parts.

I don't like directly comparing games but 90% of my playtime I just felt like I was playing a weird, clunky, slow and grindy version of Terraria. There's a lot of content to go through but it all blends together and after a few years of not having played it I struggled to actually remember any of it.

i love starbound. i have spent so much fucking time on this game just exploring and messing around in the different worlds and dungeons. if you loved terraria for the exploration and grinding, this game is for you. 

that being said, ive ONLY played this game while heavily modded. from what ive seen, the base game looks horrible. unfinished, bland, overzealous. i highly advice installing frackin universe and any other fun mods you see for the game. it makes an abandoned game whole again. 

so, i cant, in good faith, reccommend the game, but if you mod it and buy it on sale, its definitely an amazing time waster.
Purchased because I enjoyed Terraria. This game is unoptimized and many of the systems seem like they are incomplete.

This game has potential, In most all its systems... However the story just... Abruptly ends. You can tell the writers and developers did not get the time they needed for this game.

It's somewhat fun, but severely lacking in... depth. Don't expect a Terraria level of things to do.

chuckle fish is garbage. fracking universe mod. do not buy this game at full price. chuckle fish screws everyone over. so dish it back. otherwise.. it's a cute game with the mods, modding community stepped up when chucklefish decided to take erryones money n run., :]

chucklefish still sucks. FU creators are sus. The game can still be enjoyable. Better with friends to help dissipate the toxicity that surrounds the game devs and the FU mods lmao. [fr FU, how do you get away with stealing copyrighted music from Miyazaki? I'm surprised they haven't slammed your dumbasses with CND LOL]

First, I love the base-building and spaceship mechanics, they are simple, but a lot of fun to work with. The artstyle is clean, and the monsters are cute. I even love the critters, which range from snails to owls.
The story is fine, although over very quickly.
HOWEVER, even more than 300 hours in, I'm still not used to the controls, all the planets look the same, I HATE the food spoilage mechanic, and I actually resent this game for wasting my time, because so many of the achievements are boring, repetitive time-sinks.

Here are the worst;
-Finishing 50 minor sidequests for your colonists, who will pick 1 of about 3 quest templates. Boring and repetitive, but doable if you're grinding out the food achievement, just make a farm near the colony.
-Complete a specific, rare costume, where you MIGHT find one piece per galaxy, if you're lucky, and what piece you find is random.
-Dig and carry a planet's worth of dirt (No, this will not happen organically).
-Catch all the bugs, several of which require specific rare biomes, and one of the rare ones is effectively invisible.
-Collect all the armor types in game, which requires many, many hours of grinding and randomly spawned merchants, who MIGHT sell you an armor piece you don't already have.
-Collecting all the fossils, which are random. And have rarities. And a failable minigame. And only spawn underground. And there are 55 of the hateful things.
-And, finally, the one that broke me, collecting 50 **********ing figurines. After 368.2 hours, killing every monster I saw, and grinding bosses, I had 4. And 8 hours later, after grinding more bosses (who have a higher drop-rate), I had 6. That's when I just spawned them in with console commands, because **** that. 
What little of this game I play in future will be entirely to hang out with friends who invite me, and, even the, I will recommend we play a different game first.

I enjoyed the game. I think there's the bones of a good game, but Chucklefish fumbled this so badly. It's a miracle that the modding community has done as much as they have. If you really want to play the game, don't buy it. Use family sharing (or other methods) to play.

While I enjoyed Starbound, I don't think I'd recommend it to others. Like others, I found enjoyment in my first playthrough. Without mods, the game doesn't really mean much past that. I'm also upset by the allegations that the developers didn't pay their artists appropriately. There are much better 2D Sandbox Survival games that respect their artists and modders out there that I'd recommend more.

Good Luck!! Don't get me wrong.  I really enjoyed playing the game; when it would decide to work.

Played the game a few years back on the same PC and hardware.  I don't know if Windows updates ruined it but the game refuses to launch in a stable resolution full screen now.  I can't stand playing games using a "window" and know this wasn't an issue prior.  

Tried multiple resolutions; manually configuring the game files but it would either change the default back to 800 x 600 upon launch or generate a new config file ignoring the old.  Such a shame because it was fun to play.  Just be warned that you might be wasting $$

Apparently the internet is full of forums similar to my experience...  shame

I was a kickstarter backer when this game was in Early Access. I remember trying this for the first time back then, and I found the game desolate, repetitive, and needlessly grindy.

I decided to give it another try yesterday, because surely 10 years is enough to iron out all the flaws. I dug all the way to the core of the planet. I did the first dungeon and beat the first story boss. The game feels as desolate and empty as ever, and the echoey music just helps amplify that feeling. UI is awful, combat is awful, building is... serviceable but awkward because of how little you can place on the hotbar, forcing you to manually pick up items from the inventory items. Yes, people say "the mods are great" but that doesn't say anything good for the game itself. I wouldn't recommend buying this game even on sale, this is a game designed to waste your time, and not in a fun way.
Expected more from the story mode, also kinda boring, confusing and unbalanced.

this game is soooooo boring and underdeveloped without mods, they treated their devs like shit and this is what you get. not worth playing without tons of mods to make the game actually fun while letting you skip the awful vanilla content

This game is rather bland in comparison to other game similar to this, Terraria for example. Terraria is endlessly replay-able, and feels fresh every time, Starbound is grindy, bare, and empty. Not to mention the modding sucks, I modded my game and a few days later, I launch the game, and it would crash over and over again. I would not recommend this game, go buy Terraria instead.

Starbound. This one is tough cuz i do truly love this game

However i dont find myself wanting to come back super often. i usually need like a good year or two of a break before i even want to or think about coming back to it. All my memories of the game are fun. But after a couple days of playing i usually find myself a bit overwhelmed with... too many choices i guess? There so so so much you can do in the universe you play in. which kinda makes everything you do feel kinda lack luster. I have friends who've beat the game but they don't come back to it the way they will for other games. 

Lets put it this way. If you have some friends and yall have gone nothing to do and you want a fun game to play with them. This is your game. OR if you like to be alone... like in real life. If you're going through a rough time and you wanna dissociate and just get away. Get lost in something for awhile. This is the game for that. It can be exhilarating at times if you fully fully immerse yourself. But Would i recommend this game to someone...?

No i don't think i would. This is a Good, fun, enjoyable, creative, and unique game! Truly I mean that and i cherish the experiences i had with it. But i'd sooner buy someone a game like terraria... or simply just go for a walk and hang out outside. do something else creative before i even consider this one and that's the truth with zero malice in my heart. I got nothin but love for this game.

But hey if you got some extra buckaroons to spare and you just wanna try something out. You can get a good week or two of fun with this game before you get bored. Go for it! itll be worth the money. You could spend the same amount on a fast food meal and be less satisfied, get me?

Even though I played through the whole game, I have mixed feelings about it. 

The art direction and lore seemed to be pretty solid. It was fun exploring all the planets and different races. Music and sound design worked well, and i Loved the little outpost area: so full of life! Building in this game is a lot of fun, even though the hotbar is severely limited. There are SO many items you can decorate with, so there seems to be endless possibilities!

But i just had too many little annoyances that kept me from truly enjoying myself. 
The travelling by ship mechanic is never explained. 
The upgrading your crafting stations mechanic is never explained. 
The main story is 5x the same process/questline but with a different race
The storge system is diabolical, why is there no smart stacking feature? 
It is completely hidden how to recruit members for your ship, and even if you know, the process is tedious, repetitive and boring.  
The feature of placing/breaking walls is never explained. 
Money is too scarce in the beginning, and not important in the endgame
You're unkillable by the time you reach the endboss
Progression always follows the same schematic: planet -> 1 new ore -> upgrade gear and breating device -> new planet type
The "riddles" were not hard at all, although the jump and run parts and challenge portals were fun.
The amount of time i spend mindlessly walking on the surface of planets searching for a specific structure to "find clues" about a race is about 40-50% of my 30 hours of playtime. Absolutely NOT fun to search the entire planet for a avian village on the correct planet and star type, only to find out it only houses another race.

This game was fun enough for me to finish it, but i was annoyed, or felt like i was doing the same thing over and over  a lot of the time. There is more stuff to do like expand your ship (which requires A LOT of crew, which, as said, is annoying to hire!) or mess with pets or activate the arks you find in some solar systems, but the game was not fun enough for me to care.
basicly terraria but more bad, get terraria, its better.

I go to the left, I die. I go to the right, I die. I go into a mine, I die from fall damage. This game is so hostile to me I just, I can't figure this out.

I swear to god If I need to look at a fucking wiki just to play a game, then I look forward to refunding this.

P.S. The lead dev likes to claim he's being review bombed 24/7 and uses bots/paid shills to boost his number on online platforms.
